12: Angels From the Captivity to John the Baptist

Daniel and His Three Companions
     The love and fear of God was before Daniel, and he educated and trained all his powers to respond as far as possible to the loving care of the Great Teacher, conscious of his amenability to God. The four Hebrew children would not allow selfish motives and love of amusements to occupy the golden moments of this life. They worked with a willing heart and ready mind. This is no higher standard than every Christian may attain. God requires of every Christian scholar more than has been given him. Ye are \93a spectacle unto the world, and to angels, and to men.\94\97FE 230.
